properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Chapple Vale, Wangerrip, Yuulong. 
  • There is a fire at Colac Tree Road, Chapple Vale that is under control. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads, including the Great Ocean Road.
  • This Community Information replaces the notification issued at 1:56pm.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 16/01/2025 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Colac Tree Road, Chapple Vale
Issue Date: Wednesday 15 January 2025, 04:12 pm
Next Update: Thursday 16 January 2025, 06:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35812/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Chapple Vale, Wangerrip, Yuulong. 
- There is a fire at Colac Tree Road, Chapple Vale that is under control. 
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads, including the Great Ocean Road.
- This Community Information replaces the notification issued at 1:56pm.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.
  • The status of the bushfire in the Grampians National Park is now Under Control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 8.17pm Monday 13 January.
  • Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to  monitor hotspots, treat hazardous trees, clear tracks and rehabilitate control lines.
  • Small areas of smoke within the containment area may be visible.
Parts of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open to visitors. For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website or Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap.

Many popular sites in the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open. However, the areas affected by fire are closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road and walking track closures.  

Halls Gap and surrounding towns are open. Businesses and the community are welcoming visitors back to the area. 

Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Drive with caution. Obey road closure signs.  
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 226 226. 
Recovery and resilience
If you have been or may be impacted by bushfire, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Drivers may encounter fire crews and heavy machinery on roads and tracks. Please take care and drive safely. 
  • Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed. Check the VicTaffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Partial closures of the Grampians National Park remain in place, please visit Parks Vic for the latest information before you go.
  • Visitors are reminded to be cautious of ongoing risks and changes to the environment which may include fallen or damaged trees, smoke and injured wildlife.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 21/01/2025 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Thursday 16 January 2025, 03:03 pm Next Update: Tuesday 21 January 2025, 03:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35817/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire. - The status of the bushfire in the Grampians National Park is now Under Control. - This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 8.17pm Monday 13 January. - Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to monitor hotspots, treat hazardous trees, clear tracks and rehabilitate control lines. - Small areas of smoke within the containment area may be visible. Parts of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open to visitors. For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website or Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap. Many popular sites in the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open. However, the areas affected by fire are closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road and walking track closures. Halls Gap and surrounding towns are open. Businesses and the community are welcoming visitors back to the area. Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message has been re-issued for McCrae following the landslide on Tuesday 14 January.

  • A structural collapse has occurred due to a landslide on Penny Lane, McCrae. 
  • This has affected properties on Point Nepean Road.
  • There is currently no risk to foreshore area.
  • Point Nepean Road remains closed whilst ongoing monitoring and rectification works take place. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 6:50 am Wednesday 15 January.
Stay informed. Stay away from the landslide. The slope may continue to move for hours or days afterwards.
What you should do:
  • Stay away from the impacted area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Point Nepean Road is closed in both directions between Latrobe Parade, and Coburn Avenue. 
  • There is currently no timeframe on when this section of is road will re-open. 
  • For more information on road closures go to www.traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 16/01/2025 07:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#viclandslide).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - LANDSLIDE
Incident Location: McCrae
Issue Date: Wednesday 15 January 2025, 07:47 pm
Next Update: Thursday 16 January 2025, 07:50 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35813/moreinfo

This Advice message has been re-issued for McCrae following the landslide on Tuesday 14 January.

- A structural collapse has occurred due to a landslide on Penny Lane, McCrae. 
- This has affected properties on Point Nepean Road.
- There is currently no risk to foreshore area.
- Point Nepean Road remains closed whilst ongoing monitoring and rectification works take place. 
- This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 6:50 am Wednesday 15 January.


Stay informed. Stay away from the landslide. The slope may continue to move for hours or days afterwards.
